com.cmput301w20t10.uberapp.database.dao

Class UserDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cmput301w20t10.uberapp.database.base.DAOBase<UserEntity,User>
      • com.cmput301w20t10.uberapp.database.dao.UserDAO

  • public class UserDAO
extends DAOBase<UserEntity,User>
    Data Access Object (DAO) for User model. DAO contains specific operations that are concerned with the model they are associated with.

    • Method Detail

      • checkForUserCount

        public androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<java.lang.Integer> checkForUserCount(java.lang.String username)
        Checks for how many users have the same given username. Usage: 
             UserDAO dao = new UserDAO();
     MutableLiveData liveData = dao.checkForUserCount("usernameHere");
     liveData.observe(this, count -> {
         if (count == null) {
            // no internet connection
         } else if (count == 0) {
            // not yet made
         } else if (count == 1) {
            // one account made with username
         } else { // count > 1
            // two or more accounts with the same username
         }
     });
        Parameters:
        username -
        Returns:
        MutableLiveData which returns an Integer indicating the count of users with the same username or null indicating an error has occurred somewhere, likely connection loss

      • saveModel

        public androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<java.lang.Boolean> saveModel(User model)
        Description copied from class: DAOBase
        Saves all dirty fields for a given model. Dirty fields in an entity are unsaved fields. DatabaseObjectBase detects these changes. This is the method that's encouraged to use to update your models. To update your models: 

             Rider rider;

     ...
     // code that changes your rider such as
     rider.setImage("new image");
     ...

     MutableLiveData liveData = RiderDAO.getDAO();
     liveData.observe(lifecycleOwner, riderDAO -> {
         if (riderDAO != null) {
              // it is recommended that you keep your riderDAO as a local variable
              // once you have verified that riderDAO is null
              riderDAO.saveModel(rider)
                  .observe(...);
         } else {
              // error handling here
              // it is likely that the user was not logged in
              // or the user was logged out by the system
         }
     });
        Specified by:
        saveModel in class DAOBase<UserEntity,User>
        Parameters:
        model - Model to update
        Returns:
        See Also:
        DAOBase.saveModel(ModelBase)

      • getCollectionName

        protected java.lang.String getCollectionName()
        Description copied from class: DAOBase
        Get Firestore Collection name associated with the DAO. This is used for a code in DAOBAse. On the subclass, simply put: 
             protected String getCollectionName() {
         return COLLECTION; // where COLLECTION is a static final String
     }
        Specified by:
        getCollectionName in class DAOBase<UserEntity,User>
        Returns:
        COLLECTION String representing the collection name in Firestore

        protected DAOBase<UserEntity,User> create()
        Description copied from class: DAOBase

             // UserDAO extends DAOBase
     return new UserDAO();
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • createModelFromEntity

        protected androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<User> createModelFromEntity(UserEntity userEntity)
        Description copied from class: DAOBase
        Follows the pattern: 
        return new Model(entity);
        Some Models require several entities so some methods would expect: 
        return new Model(entity, otherEntityList.get(0))
        Specified by:

      • getUserByUserID

        public androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<User> getUserByUserID(java.lang.String userId)
        Gets a User object using their DocumentID. 
             UserDAO dao = new UserDAO();
     MutableLiveData liveData = dao.getUserByUserID(userId);
     liveData.observe(this, user -> {
         if (user != null) {
             // user found
         } else {
             // no internet connection
         }
     });
        Parameters:
        userId - Document ID for the User
        Returns:
        User returns a User object if User was successfully found null returns a null object if User was not found or an error has occurred
